'Corynebacterium' (kÃ´r"u-nÄ-bak-tÄr'Ä-um, ku-rin'u-) is a genus of Gram-
positive, rod-shaped bacteria. They are widely distributed in nature and are
mostly innocuous. Some are useful in industrial settings
such as [[C. glutamicum]]. Others can cause human
disease. [[Corynebacterium diphtheriae|C. diphtheriae]], for example, is the
pathogen responsible for diphtheria.
